Details: #description+i_en
1 IFRC national staff killed and 4 wounded by Israeli army.
1 UN national staff shot and killed in Tulkarem, West Bank, March 7.
1 INGO national staff received minor wounds when settlers shot at a team repairing a deliberately vandalized water source.
One UN international staff shot and killed at the Jenin refugee camp by Israeli army gunfire, Nov 22.

City: Bureij Camp, east of the Salah al-Din Road
Details: Two UN national staff in Bureij Camp, Gaza Strip by IDF operations.
Two RC national staff wounded by Israeli fire in Gaza.
1 UN national staff killed in Younis Refugee Camp.
1 UN national staff killed in explosion.
1 UN national staff stabbed to death.
1 UN national staff killed by gunshot wounds in the West Bank, Oct 1.
1 ICRC international (Swiss) staff was abducted by unknown armed men at the ICRC office in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip.
1 UN national staff killed in West Bank by gunshot wounds, May 30.
One UN national staff member killed in a residential area by a missile fired by Israeli forces against an alleged Palestinian faction in the Ein el-Hilweh refugee camp in Saida, 14 August.

Two RC national staff killed in Gaza Strip, Nov 3. The two paramedics had left their ambulance to evacuate a dead body when IDF munitions hit the area. Announced by ICRC, who said they were marked with clear emblems and wearing florescent jackets.
1 UN national staff teacher injured in crossfire during armed dashes that took place in the vicinity of UN schools in Gaza, Dec 19. A 13-year-old school girl was also injured (not counted here).
1 NGO national staff abducted in front of their son by unknown men and found dead the next day.
1 UN national staff wounded.

One UN national staff was shot and died the following day. The agency is temporarily suspending all but emergency medical and food programmes. The victim appears to have been caught in the crossfire and not targeted because of UN affiliation.

One UN national staff was shot in the head. The agency is temporarily suspending all but emergency medical and food programmes. The victim appears to have been caught in the crossfire and not targeted because of UN affiliation.
One UN national staff school teacher killed at home in Gaza in an operation conducted by the Israel Defense Forces.
One INGO national staff wounded in when military firearms discharged.
5 UN staff were killed during the December 2008 - January 2009 conflict. Exact dates and locations are unknown at this time.
1 UN national staff killed and 2 RC national staff medical personnel wounded while on duty, after an air strike hit a location in Jabaliya.
1 UN national staff killed in his house in Gaza, 5 January.
1 UN national staff contracted driver killed.
One INGO national staff of a local NGO partner was killed in an aerial bombing in Gaza. Violence halted most of the INGO's aid distribution in Gaza Strip.
One UN national staff driver killed and one UN national staff driver injured when UN convoy was hit by tank shell in Gaza. UN suspended all operations.
One UN national staff killed in Gaza during a drone strike, 8 January.
Two UN national staff killed at home during a bombardment in Gaza, 15 January.
1 INGO international (Japanese) staff wounded in military action in Gaza.
One UN staff member was shot and killed by IDF soldiers during clashes on an overnight arrest raid at the Qalandia refugee camp.
7 UN staff were killed during the July 2014 conflict. Exact dates and locations unknown at this time.
One UN worker was killed due to an air strike. The attack also killed her husband and daughter (not counted in database).
One UN worker was killed while fleeing from fighting in Shejaiya district. Ten members of her family (not counted in database) were also killed in the attack.
One UN worker was killed during an air strike as he was on his way home.
One Palestine Red Crescent Society volunteer was killed and three others wounded when their ambulance (clearly marked with the emblem of the Red Crescent society) was targeted in Beit Hanoun.
One Palestine Red Crescent Society volunteer was shot and killed.

One INGO aid worker was killed in Khan Younis during an attack on the residential neighborhood. He was taking refuge from the attack when he was killed (most likely from artillery or other aerial fire). The Israeli military reported that their attack on Khan Younis was in response to earlier Hamas firing on Israeli targets.
One UN guard was killed during an air strike in Rafah in southern Gaza.

One INGO national male staff member was detained at the crossing between Gaza and Israel by the Israel Defense Forces on allegations of terror financing. Media reports from 2020 indicate the staff member was tortured in custody causing damage to his head/hearing.

One volunteer was shot dead in Nablus in the West Bank. More than twenty bullets were shot from a passing vehicle during the drive-by unknown assailants. The volunteer was pronounced dead on arrival at the hospital.

One female medical volunteer with an NGO was shot and killed by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Gaza during a protest. According to witness reports and cellphone footage, the volunteer was moving with her hands up and identification card displayed toward a protestor who was close to the border fence and had been affected by tear gas. A preliminary IDF investigation stated that she was not specifically targeted in the attack.
One male employee of an INGO was shot and killed by Israeli border soldiers in the Occupied Palestinian Territories for allegedly approaching the Gaza Strip/Israel border fence with a weapon.

One male national INGO volunteer was reportedly shot and killed by Israeli forces during a clash at the Dheisha refugee camp south of Bethlehem in the West Bank. Reports outline the volunteer paramedic was working within the camp, when others in the area throwing rocks prompted a response from Israeli soldiers.

One Palestinian paramedic with the Palestinian Red Crescent was reportedly shot in the face with a rubber bullet, while performing humanitarian activities, by the Israeli military. The military shots came from the border wall east of Khan Younis on May 11, 2019. On June 11, 2019 the RC volunteer succumbed to his wounds and died in a hospital in Gaza.

One Palestinian Red Cross paramedic was wounded when shot in the stomach by Israeli forces after a reported raid of the Occupied East Jerusalem neighbourhood Al-Issawiya. Reports indicate the occupying forces attacked civilians and attacked Red Cross staff with rubber bullets to prevent them from transporting civilian patients to the hospital.

One Palestinian Red Crescent volunteer paramedic was shot in the head by the Israeli Army with a rubber bullet. The incident reportedly occurred while the paramedic was trying to assist victims during clashes in the town of Abu Dis, east of Jerusalem. He was transferred to the hospital for medical treatment.

One female volunteer paramedic was injured in the head with a plastic-coated steel bullet while trying to assist wounded during the Great March of Return protests in the Occupied Palestinian Territories.

One male volunteer paramedic for the Palestinian Red Crescent Society and one male volunteer paramedic for a local NGO were both wounded with plastic-coated steel bullets at demonstrations in Khan Younis district of the Gaza Strip. The staff members were struck on the left thigh and neck respectively.

One male volunteer paramedic with the Palestinian Red Crescent was injured after a reported direct blow of a tear gas canister to his right leg during Friday demonstrations in the North Gaza District.
One Red Crescent paramedic was injured by the glass from a broken windshield after Israel Defense Forces shot at the clearly marked ambulance in the Occupied Palestinian Territories.

Two ICRC staff were reportedly peppered sprayed by Israeli settlers in Burin, Nablus, during a joint field visit with Palestinian farmers and IDF officials. The staff received medical attention at the military base.

One Palestinian Red Crescent health worker in a marked ambulance was injured after being hit with a rifle by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Beit Farouk locality, South of Nablus (Nablus governorate). Another health worker was also injured (injury extent unknown).

Two Palestinian Red Crescent Society members were injured by rubber-coated bullets when reaching a 2-year-old child suffering from a heart condition who had been exposed to teargas. The team was prevented from reaching the child's house by Israeli defence forces, and were not able to leave the place for 40 minutes after taking care of the patient.

One national Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was injured when the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) attacked his ambulance and an Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) stationed at the Bab Al-Asbat area, near Al-Aqsa Mosque. In addition, the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) shot a sound bomb at the ambulance, breaking the mirror on the driver's side.
One Palestinian Red Crescent Society medical staff was allegedly shot in the two feet by the Israel Defence Forces while on duty in Askar Camp.

One female health worker and one male ambulance driver of INGO-supported medical facilities were killed in shelling from the Israel Defense Forces in Khan Younis, Gaza. Other people were injured in the same attack (not counted here).
Four Palestinian Red Crescent Society paramedics were killed when the ambulance they were in was hit by an aerial attack in the Gaza Strip.
One Palestinian Red Crescent paramedic was shot in the back and killed at the Karni crossing in eastern Gaza.
One female national NGO aid worker was killed during an aerial bombardment affecting the Church of Saint Porphyrius in Gaza.
One male head of UN aid agency was injured due to shelling from the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip.

70 UN aid workers have been killed and 22 have been injured during the clashes between the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between October 7 and October 31, 2023. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.

One Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was injured when the ambulance was targeted by an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) strike at the entrance of Al-Shifa hospital, Gaza Strip. The ambulance was the second one targeted during the same attack. Other civilians were also injured (not counted).
One national, international organisation aid worker was killed along with his family during an airstrike in Gaza.
One national INGO aid worker was killed along with his family in his house during an airstrike in Gaza City.

19 Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid workers have been injured on duty between the 7th of October and the 7th of November in the Gaza Strip. Eight emergency vehicles had been put out of service due to the damage caused by airstrikes.
Two national INGO aid workers were killed due to a missile strike of the Jabalia refugee camp in the Gaza Strip.

One male national INGO aid worker was killed during a shooting to a convoy of marked vehicles with authorization to evacuate in Al Wahida, Gaza. Another civilian was also killed during the incident (not counted).
Two male INGO doctors were killed due to a strike in the Al-Awda hospital in Gaza.
One female UN aid worker was killed along with her family during a shelling in Southern Gaza.
One off-duty male ICRC driver was killed in Northern Gaza along with other members of his family (not counted here).

41 UN aid workers have been killed and 5 have been injured during the clashes between the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between November 1 and November 30, 2023. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
One female national INGO aid worker was killed along with her family in Khan Younis at some point in December 2023.
One INGO health worker was injured by a shot fired from outside in Al-Awda Hospital, in Gaza.
One male INGO aid worker was killed along with his family by an airstrike in Gaza.
One UN national aid worker was killed with his family during an aerial bombardment in Gaza City.

31 UN aid workers have been killed during the clashes between the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between December 1 and December 31, 2023. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
Four national Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid workers were killed when their ambulance was hit by a shell in Gaza. Two other injured civilians were also killed (not counted).
Two male national aid workers of the Palestinian Red Crescent Society were shot and killed close to Al Amal Hospital in Khan Younis.

10 UN aid workers have been killed and 1 UN aid worker has been injured during the clashes between the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between the 1 and the 31 of January, 2024. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
One female Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was shot and killed by a sniper in Khan Younis.
One male Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was shot and killed while evacuating wounded people in Gaza.
Two national Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid workers were killed when the ambulance they were in was hit in Gaza.

8 UN aid workers have been killed during the clashes between the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between the 1st and the 29th of February, 2024. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
One male national INGO aid worker was killed along with his family during an aerial strike in Khirbat al 'Adas, Gaza.
One UN aid worker was killed, and 22 UN aid workers were injured during a drone attack on a UN distribution centre in Rafah, Gaza.

5 UN aid workers have been killed during the clashes between the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between the 1st and the 14th of March, 2024. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
Two male staff members of the Palestinian Red Crescent were killed during the evacuation of the Al Amal Hospital in Khan Yunis.

According to the Palestinian Red Crescent, 11 off-duty staff members have been killed in the Gaza Strip from collateral violence since October 7, 2023. Further details on the individual incidents is not available at this time.

7 INGO staff members, including 1 national and 6 international staff, were killed in an Israel Defense Force strike in Central Gaza, as their aid convoy left a warehouse. One additional national INGO staff was injured. According to official statements, the vehicles were all clearly marked and information on their movements had been shared with parties to the conflict. Israel has taken responsibility for the attack, calling it "unintentional." The INGO has suspended all operations in the area.
One INGO staff member was seriously injured after an airstrike hit his home in Central Gaza, Deir al-Balah.
